A few So old Memoires.

by a Barr Colonist.

On March Seventeenth, nineteen hundred three,
Pat left his happy home, to cross the blue sea,
To join in the Colony of one Isaac Barr,
A man whom he had not encountered so far.
To leave a happy home, and perhaps forever,
In the life of the Irish, is third most frequent endeavor.
The tears welled up in his bright green eyes,
The rain dropped heavily from the mighty skies—
At the cottage doors, the bellows went.
For all that night, they hardly slept.
He was driven to Athlone on the lovely Shannon,
To catch the early train for dear old Dublin.
That night he crossed the Irish Sea to Liverpool,
And felt worse than the day he first left for school.
There he embarked on a ship named the H.M.S. Megantic,
A vessel that carried him safely o'er the Atlantic.
On board were some Englishmen, and some had wives,
Who had given Isaac Barr a hand in their lives.
For fourteen long days, the sea it was rough,
And many of the passengers found the going too tough.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual would be asked to answer it in exactly the same experiences as another. Similarly, the answers to these questions may vary from one person to another depending upon their personal experiences.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1974, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Have?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you know are willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All Questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:
